meanings.definition: Offensive to morality or decency; indecent.
meanings.sent1: The movie contained obscene scenes that made many people uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The artist was criticized for creating obscene paintings that were deemed inappropriate for public display.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke about the obscene outfit worn by a clown had the audience bursting into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The stench coming from the dumpster was so obscene, it could be smelled from a mile away.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the wall was so obscene that it shocked even the most hardened city dwellers.

meanings.sent1: The garbage left unattended for weeks emitted an obscene odor throughout the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house was in an obscene state of disrepair, with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the expired milk was so obscene that it made everyone gag.
meanings.sent4: The sight of the decaying fruit in the bowl was an obscene reminder of neglect.
meanings.sent5: The slimy texture of the spoiled food was truly obscene to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The criminal's actions were so obscene that they shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent2: The dictator's regime was characterized by obscene acts of violence against innocent civilians.
meanings.sent3: The politician's corrupt behavior was so obscene that it led to his downfall.
meanings.sent4: The company's unethical practices were considered obscene by the public.
meanings.sent5: The level of pollution in the river was so obscene that it posed a serious threat to aquatic life.
